course_title: Promoting Positive Student Behaviour and Wellbeing

learning_outcomes.description: Critically appraise the evidence underpinning practices used to support student engagement, behaviour, connectedness, and wellbeing and establish and sustain safe and supportive learning environments.
Identify and apply evidence-informed approaches specifically aimed at providing multi-tiered systems of support that include social, emotional, and behavioural supports for students.
Design safe and supportive learning environments for primary school students and apply approaches that teach and reinforce desired classroom behaviours.
Analyse the relationship between function of behaviour and environment, including cultural and contextual factors.
Synthesise research to explore links between student behaviour and wellbeing, and engagement and learning.
Investigate practices that can prevent student disengagement and develop plans for students who are exhibiting behaviours of concern.
Critically reflect on implications for promoting positive student wellbeing and behaviour in professional practice and productive relationships with students, families, and communities.
Demonstrate all teaching and professional requirements of the professional experience placement.
Demonstrate an understanding of schools as workplaces and be familiar with the statutory, ethical and other requirements that govern the work of teachers in schools.

assessments.task_description: Students must read the Policies and Procedures for Professional Experience Placements document and respond to the statement declaration on Blackboard by the due date. Failure to do so will result in a withdrawal of the placement and the awarding of a grade of Fail for the course.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.
assessments.late_submission: Failure to complete this task by the due date may result in a fail for the assessment and therefore the course.
assessments.additional_info: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.

assessments.assessment_title: 1B Professional Experience and Final Evaluation Report
assessments.task_description: Students are required to successfully complete 15 days of a supervised and assessed professional experience block placement in an approved school setting. The placement will be arranged only by the School of Education.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Upload signed final evaluation report via blackboard.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.
assessments.late_submission: Failure to submit the signed final evaluation report by the due date will result in a failing grade for the assessment item and the course.
assessments.additional_info: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.

assessments.task_description:
In each of the 8 workshops a short quiz will be completed by students and the results will be uploaded to Gradebook. This is a hurdle requirement, each weeks quiz will be graded as pass or fail. Each quiz will be designed to be completed in a maximum of 10 minutes. Students must attempt all quizzes, and pass at least half as a requirement of passing the course overall.

This is a secure assessment task.
assessments.submission_guidelines: The quiz will be made available during the workshops for a set period of time. After the time the quiz will be closed.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.
assessments.late_submission: Students who fail to attend a tutorial in which a quiz is administered will receive no mark for that week. However, a session will be provided at the end of semester during teaching weeks where students will be provided with a supplementary quiz for each week missed.
assessments.additional_info: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.

assessments.task_description:
Select from a scenario (provided on UQ Learn) that describes a learner who might be vulnerable in a primary classroom and use research-informed and culturally responsive strategies to design an action plan to increase student connectedness, and address the wellbeing needs of both the student and the teacher. The plan should include strategies for engaging with families.

APST 1.1, 1.3, 1.4, 3.7, 4.1, 4.3, 4.4, 7.3
assessments.submission_guidelines: Submission instructions are outlined on UQ Learn (Blackboard).
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 1 grade for each 24 hour period from time submission is due will apply for up to 7 days. After 7 days you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
Select from a case study (provided on UQ Learn) and write a multi-tiered plan to enhance student engagement and support student behaviour. Include within the plan strategies to prevent behaviours of concern, and to teach and reinforce desired behaviours. 

APST 3.5, 4.1, 4.2, 4.3, 4.4
assessments.submission_guidelines: Submission instructions are outlined on UQ Learn (Blackboard).
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 1 grade for each 24 hour period from time submission is due will apply for up to 7 days. After 7 days you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

Week 1

Positive greetings at the door, call to attention, creating predictability through routines, giving instructions.


Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03, L04, L05, L06

learning_activities.topic:
Week 1

Lecture 1: An overview of the current policies, whole-school behaviour frameworks and practices that are promoted to create and sustain Positive Learning Environments and create high expectations to reinforce learning habits for students.



Learning outcomes: L01, L07

Week 8 - 12
